column5: Yeah, have been led to understand the card makes it easier for you if involved in an accident. I can't see the insurance folks having the card to give to its holders if the need wasn't there. Bill
Been carrying a Canada insurance card issued by my insurance company for years. They have me on a automated list, they send them to me every year in April. Happy Fishin' Walley

Hey all, just found out we can take my friends Dad's RV on the Trek to Canada. What would we need to do for that? Since his Dad won't be there and the RV is registered and titled in his name will this be an issue? Anyone know?
Or who could I call or find out about this?
just get a letter from the owner and you will be fine. you don't need anything technically to use someone else's vehicle here.
yup. just make sure you leave your guns, throwing stars, switch blades etc at home ok?
Be sure you get a Canadian Insurance Card from the owner's vehicle insurance company, in case you're involved with an accident up north of the border. Have a great (and safe) trip. Rich B
Wow that is wierd I was just going to post nearly exactley the same question! Except it is a friends RV, and I thought about just sending a pm to jinx. So thanks for the post and the answers.
what are you talking about? you don't need a different insurance for Canada. I'm lost here.

In my experience you typically don't buy additional vehicle insurance for the Canadian trip but you do ask your auto insurance agent for a Canada Insurance Card. This procedure may be a relic of times before you carried a proof on insurance card (Anyway that is what we do in Iowa.) I suggest that the letter from the owner mention those permitted to drive the vehicle. Hope there is no accident but I would hate to see the insurance company try to deny coverage.

I to have always gone to my agent & got a Canada Insurance Card that just shows that you at least carry the minimum auto insurance while in Canada. They do exist as it is a preprinted card that they have on hand at least here in Iowa. Later, Jay
